in.ac.iitk.cse.putwb.experiment

Class RecoveryManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • in.ac.iitk.cse.putwb.experiment.RecoveryManager

  • public class RecoveryManager
extends Object
    This class provides the implementation for a recovery tool, part of the CLI of PUTWorkbench. The class provides methods to write essential recovery information to a recovery file. If a PUTExperiment fails to complete, a recovery file associated with it could be used to resume the experiment from the last saved state.
    Author:
    Saurabh Srivastava

    • Constructor Detail

      • RecoveryManager

        public RecoveryManager(File recoveryFile)
                throws FileNotFoundException,
                       IOException
        Equivalent to RecoveryManager(File,true)
        Parameters:
        recoveryFile - The recovery file to use
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - If the recovery file is not found and could not be created
        IOException - If an error occurs while trying to read/write to the recovery file
        See Also:
        RecoveryManager(File, boolean)

      • RecoveryManager

        public RecoveryManager(File recoveryFile,
                       boolean recoverFrom)
                throws FileNotFoundException,
                       IOException
        Creates a recovery manager which can be used to either print recovery information for a running PUTExperiment, or recover an interrupted PUTExperiment after interruption.
        Parameters:
        recoveryFile - The recovery file to use
        recoverFrom - true, indicates that this recovery manager will be used for resuming an interrupted experiment, false indicates that the recovery manager will be used for printing recovery information to a recovery file during the execution of an experiment
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - If the recovery file is not found and could not be created
        IOException - If an error occurs while trying to read/write to the recovery file

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(String[] arr)
        The main to run the recovery manager
        Parameters:
        arr - The commandline arguments for running the experiment

      • printUsageDetails

        public static void printUsageDetails()
        Prints a summary of the usage of the Recovery Manager

      • deleteRecoveryFile

        public void deleteRecoveryFile()
                        throws IOException
        Deletes the recovery file, if the manager was configured
        Throws:
        IOException - If an error while closing the opened streams to the file

      • printHeader

        public void printHeader(String[] headerInfo)
                 throws IllegalStateException,
                        IllegalArgumentException,
                        IOException
        Prints header information of the experiment to the recovery file.
        Parameters:
        headerInfo - The header information to print
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If this recovery manager is not configured to print recovery information
        IllegalArgumentException - If the number of elements in the header array are odd
        IOException - If an error occurs while writing the recovery information

      • printPartition

        public void printPartition(Set<Integer> partition)
                    throws IllegalStateException,
                           IOException
        Prints a partition to the recovery file
        Parameters:
        partition - The partition to print
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If this recovery manager is not configured to print recovery information
        IOException - If an error occurs while writing the recovery information

      • printPartitionsMetadata

        public void printPartitionsMetadata(int numberOfPartitions,
                                    boolean randomGeneration)
                             throws IllegalStateException,
                                    IOException
        Prints partitions related information of the experiment to the recovery file.
        Parameters:
        numberOfPartitions - The number of partitions being used for the experiment
        randomGeneration - true signifies that the random generation method has been used for generating partitions, false signifies that the generation is done in dictionary order
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If this recovery manager is not configured to print recovery information
        IOException - If an error occurs while writing the recovery information

      • printStats

        public void printStats(Stats stat)
                throws IllegalStateException,
                       IOException
        Print a collected stat to the recovery file
        Parameters:
        stat - The stat to print
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If this recovery manager is not configured to print recovery information
        IOException - If an error occurs while writing the recovery information

      • recoverStats

        public void recoverStats()
                  throws IllegalStateException,
                         ClassNotFoundException,
                         IOException
        Recovers the stats stored in a recovery file, and save them to an output file. The output file name is the same as the experiment was configured to use (or "results.csv" if no name could be determined), and is created in the current directory. The original dataset is also required for the results to be interpreted. If the dataset is not found at the specified location, another attempt is made to find it in the current directory.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If this recovery manager is not configured to print recovery information
        ClassNotFoundException - If a problem occurs while interpreting the data stored in the recovery file
        IOException - If a problem occurs while reading the recovery file

      • restoreExperiment

        public void restoreExperiment()
                       throws IllegalStateException,
                              ClassNotFoundException,
                              IOException
        Restores the experiment linked to this recovery manager. The recovery can either be done from the partition generation stage, or after the partition generation stage, depending upon the information available in the recovery file. If the partition information was not present in the recovery file, the recovery would fail. In this case, it is better to restart the experiment from the scratch.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If this recovery manager is not configured to print recovery information
        ClassNotFoundException - If a problem occurs while interpreting the data stored in the recovery file
        IOException - If a problem occurs while reading the recovery file
